cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles SSE of Mobile, Alabama
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to curve north-northwest over Mississippi and Arkansas later this week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Mississippi/Alabama border (close to Gulfport–Biloxi)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from west of Shell Beach, LA, to the Mouth of the Mississippi River and east of Dauphin Island, AL, to Navarre, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning west of the Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, LA (including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas); Hurricane Warning Mouth of the Pearl River to the Alabama-Florida border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana coast east of Grand Isle through Mississippi, Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts possible (probability ≤4%) mainly late Tuesday night through early Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft inundation possible along the lower Mississippi River delta; negligible surge expected upriver at Baton Rouge.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with isolated totals near 12 inches possible Wednesday, leading to flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Wednesday as outer rainbands move inland; temporary navigation restrictions on the Mississippi River likely due to heavy rain and gusty winds.
